Â Â Â Â Â Sun, 03 Apr 2022 21:25:24 GMT Â Â Â Â Â  Sunday, 3rd April, 2022 Â Â Â Â Â https://fondoftea.com#Sunday%2C%203rd%20April%2C%202022 Â Â Â Â Â https://fondoftea.com#Sunday%2C%203rd%20April%2C%202022 Â Â Â Â Â Sun, 03 Apr 2022 21:24:47 GMT Â Â Â Â Â 

Been playing Dark Forest. The logo looks like Dwarf Fortress. I've just started my own universe with a friend whilst the main game is in limbo until the next round starts (assuming I get an entry). Mostly just want to see how it works and understand what all the fuss is about.

I do like it. There's not too many rules, but there's a lot of strategy involved. I like the time-basd nature of it, and I can see why people enjoy it. I like that there's no play to win, pay to win, or any monetary association with it. It's like software on Linux - people made it because they could, not necessarily because there was a need. But it's nice that it's open soruce, and you can add plugins via jacvascript (which other people share). There's a nice community to it, having fun, competing but working together.

Doesn't it just sound fun ğŸŒ²ğŸŒ³

This guy made a receipt printer output github issues as tickets. I don't need github issues but this is a neat idea for printing things to do, or lists or just stuff that isn't on letter/A4 sized paper....now I want one of those thermal printers...

Â Â Â Â Â  Â Â Â Â Â  Thursday, 31st March, 2022 Â Â Â Â Â https://fondoftea.com#Thursday%2C%2031st%20March%2C%202022 Â Â Â Â Â https://fondoftea.com#Thursday%2C%2031st%20March%2C%202022 Â Â Â Â Â Thu, 31 Mar 2022 20:09:19 GMT Â Â Â Â Â 

It's national take a meter reading day. Not because of some patron saint or trying to encourage good habits but because most of everyone is about to suffer horrendous energy price increases. Supermarkets have reported fewer root vegetables are being sold as people don't want to use the gas to boil them. At least it's April tomorrow and maybe it'll just be an April Fools'...but if nothing else the weather should be getting slowly milder. It just delays people deciding between food and heat. I'm grateful that whilst the extra cost is horrible, it doesn't make us have to make difficult decisions.

The thing with prices going up "for temporary reasons" is that they never really seem to ever go back to where they were.

It's annoying enough that Amazon Prime Videos isn't releasing Picard Season 2 in a single lump, but that the whole world has to wait for 6 pm PDT is frustrating. Maybe I should watch Voyager until all the rest of Picard is out.

I never did anything with my home site...or that wordpress blog I made.

My 50 mm f/2 fuji lens arrived today. I took a picture of it and my other fuji primes. However, my phone didn't save the photos...so I don't have it, and now I can't be bothered to line them all up again. Also annoyingly I'd taken a meter reading with it and now I don't know what it was, and again, can't be bothered to go back outside and check it. Clearly if I had another camera, this wouldn't have been an issue.

My iPad had some issue a while back and I had to factory restore it, now I think my iPhone has a similar issue and needs wiping. It is a good way to clear out junk apps that I don't really need.

After a lovely warm weekend, today's weather has been extremely variable. Snow, sun, hail, rain, and now sun again. But cold.

Started watching Picard season two. How does Picard get to the Stargazer so quickly in the first episode? I guess that space anomaly must be close to Earth? I normally don't care about things like this as it's a story, but normally Star Trek is good about this stuff. I don't care enough to google it or start a thread about it though, and am just continuing to watch it.

It's been about 3 weeks since I joined the nvidia FE GPU telegram channel, several EU ones have come up and 3090 Ti but I don't really want to spend Â£1900 on a GPU...it is the very fastest one but never buy the very fastest one. I know the ones I want will appear when I'm driving, or presenting a meeting, or generally doing something where I can't immediately buy it.

I'm mostly happy with Photos app and my photos workflow. I just feel like Auto in Lightroom does a better job than auto in Photos. Mostly I accept what comes out of camera, perhaps a little cropping, but sometimes the shadows and highlights aren't great and I want it to fix it. Perhaps my imagination but I feel like Lightroom always did a better job of it. I have to fiddle about within Photos to make it better and "ain't nobody got time for that". Adding lightroom to the mix would be a pain though.

The old Mac Mini seems to get worked up about importing photos and doing too many things at once. Reminds me of my thoughts about a M1/M2 mac mini.

If you maintain long streaks you get bigger bonuses. The idea was to get enough points to buy something. Although itâ€™ll take a long time.

People say they get 20k points a month, but I think a good portion is via Xbox, which I donâ€™t have.

Â Â Â Â Â  Â Â Â Â Â  Wednesday, 23rd March, 2022 Â Â Â Â Â https://fondoftea.com#Wednesday%2C%2023rd%20March%2C%202022 Â Â Â Â Â https://fondoftea.com#Wednesday%2C%2023rd%20March%2C%202022 Â Â Â Â Â Wed, 23 Mar 2022 21:25:13 GMT Â Â Â Â Â 

Phil alerted me to/reminded me about The Online Photographer's blog and the One camera, one lens, one year project.

I love this. Well I love the idea of it. I can see myself starting then 1-2 weeks in giving up as I struggle to take enough photos. I don't really go anywhere...home, work, home, then weekend. Weekend is fine, but during the week? I do have a lot of subjects at home with kids, so maybe it's okay. If I had a pocketable camera (iPhone anyone?) then I could take it on my cycle commute and likely pick out something on the way to and from work. Maybe I'm just looking for reasons to buy another camera and seeing it in this project.

Would be great to do the film version. I'd love to do that more, but 50+ films to buy and develop is unfortunately not an insignificant amount. In fact it could probably buy a GR3 (The camera I think I'd want to use for the digital one because of it's pocketability - although the 28mm eq. is a bit wide, guess 40mm is what would be better? although doesn't really matter.).

The Europe gas prices crisis is about to hit all homes in the UK come 1st April with the supplier price cap lifts. My supplier suggested my bill will increase 215%. Joy.

My Raspberry Pi Zero 2 arrived today. Waiting for my soldering iron from china to arrive now before I can solder the GPIO header on and then attached it to the e-ink screen. AND then do nothing ğŸ˜…

Kodak Gold 200 is now available (or about to be) in 120 format. Shame it's not the cheap, secret colour film I felt like it was just 2 years ago. I do like Gold, and it is still cheaper than Portra but it's now a price that I second guess when I look at it. Or I just hold out hope for random sales or stacking coupons etc. to get some.

Nintendo finally came through and re-sent my code via email.
